page.title: 10LAND USE DOWNLAND MINAL
page.content: From the analyses on p. 4-9 it will be seen that the land is predominantly under intensive cultivation, Only in squares 220730 and 220710 are there significant areas of woodland farms 1 & 4. This covers less than 25% of the squares. The majority of the woods and hedges are of mixed trees and semi-wild. There is some interest in conservation, and shelter belts are planted where necessary. At Warren Farm no. 5, new hedges and trees are being planted. The woodland is used as pheasant preserve. There is a small area of natural grassland on the scarp surrounding the chalkpit, 206738. Some of the pasture on the scarp has not been ploughed in recent years, if ever, but may have been fertilised, thus changing the ecological balance.
